biomes.description:
Ancient's Landing is a biome in Eternity Isle, available only in the paid expansion A Rift in Time.

It is the first biome unlocked, and is located on the south side of Eternity Isle. It's unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the quest The Port of Many Worlds.
biomes.name: Ancient's Landing

biomes.description: The Cursed Cave or Mysterious Cave is a Location where Ursula is first encountered.
biomes.name: Cursed Cave

biomes.description: The Dark Castle is a Location accessed through a portal during the The Dark Castle. Is a darker version of the Dream Castle, with night thorns obstructing the stairs, shattered pillars, and other rubble strewn about.
biomes.name: Dark Castle

biomes.description:
The Dark Grove is a location where Donald Duck is encountered during the Story Quest Lost in the Dark Grove. It can be accessed through a portal found in the southwest corner of the Forest of Valor, where Kristoff will be standing outside.

To reach the Dark Grove, the Player must select Enter on the dark portal in the Forest of Valor after unlocking the biome. After the quest Lost in the Dark Grove is complete the portal will close and the Dark Grove can no longer be accessed.
biomes.name: Dark Grove

biomes.description:
Dazzle Beach is a biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is located in the southern coastal area connected to the Peaceful Meadow, the Forest of Valor and the Glade of Trust.

The thorns blocking the pathway to this biome can be cleared using 1,000 Dreamlight.
biomes.name: Dazzle Beach

biomes.description:
The Deserted Island is a Location where Ariel is first encountered during her Friendship Quest The Lonely Island. It will already be placed when beginning a new game and its entrance is found in the southeast quadrant of Dazzle Beach, on the island near the Skull Rock.
To reach the island, the Player must Embark on the raft repaired during the quest The Mysterious Wreck.
biomes.name: Dark Grove

biomes.description: The Dreamscape is a Location accessed through a portal inside a treehouse disguised as a large rock in the Forgotten Lands during the quest Miracles Take Time.
biomes.name: Dreamscape

biomes.description: The Elephant Graveyard is a Location. It is a specific region of the Sunlit Plateau decorated with bones and foggy lighting effects. The Giant Skull is originally found in this location.
biomes.name: Elephant Graveyard

biomes.description: Everafter is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.
biomes.name: Everafter

biomes.description:
Forest of Valor is a forested biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is located on the east side of the Valley connected to the Plaza, Peaceful Meadow, and Frosted Heights.

The thorns blocking the pathway to this biome can be cleared using 3,000 Dreamlight.
biomes.name: Forest of Valor

biomes.description:
The Forgotten Lands is a dark forest biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is located in the north-west side of the Valley connected to the Sunlit Plateau.

The thorns blocking the pathway to this biome can be cleared using 15,000 Dreamlight.
biomes.name: Forgotten Lands

biomes.description:
The Frosted Heights is a snowy biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is located on the north-east side of the Valley connected to the Forest of Valor.

The thorns blocking the pathway to this biome can be cleared using 10,000 Dreamlight.
biomes.name: Frosted Heights

biomes.description:
The Glade of Trust is a biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is located on on the south-west side of the Valley, connected to the Peaceful Meadow, and Dazzle Beach.

The thorns blocking the pathway to this biome can be cleared using 5,000 Dreamlight.
biomes.name: Glade of Trust

biomes.description:
The Glittering Dunes is a biome in Eternity Isle, available after purchasing the expansion A Rift in Time.

It is located on the north-west side of Eternity Isle.

The broken bridge blocking the pathway to this biome can be repaired using 2,000 Mist during the quest The Sands in the Hourglass.
biomes.name: Glittering Dunes

biomes.description: The Herbalist Room is a Location. It cannot be entered until it is unlocked during the Simba Level 7 Friendship quest "Seed of Memories".
biomes.name: Herbalist Room

biomes.description:
Kristoff's Stall is a stall operated by Kristoff.
It sells a variety of foraged resources and refined materials. The stock cycles daily. Only limited quantities of each resource may be purchased per day.
biomes.name: Kristoff's Stall

biomes.description: Mount Olympus is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.
biomes.name: Mount Olympus

biomes.description: The Mystical Cave is a Location. It is a dark, mysterious cave that has 4 levels descending into the earth, with a pool of water and broken pillars at the lowest level.
biomes.name: Mystical Cave

biomes.description: Mythopia is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.
biomes.name: Mythopia

biomes.description:
The Peaceful Meadow is a biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is the second area players will discover, and is located to the south of the Plaza. It is further connected to the Glade of Trust, Dazzle Beach, and the Forest of Valor.
biomes.name: Peaceful Meadow

biomes.description:
The Plaza is the area of Dreamlight Valley where the game begins.

It's located in the center of the map, and connected to the Peaceful Meadow, the Sunlit Plateau, and the Forest of Valor. It is also the only biome connected to the entrance to the Dream Castle.
biomes.name: Plaza

biomes.description: The Ruins are a Location. It is a specific region of the Forgotten Lands. The Pedestals used in the Ursula Level 10 Friendship quest "A Deal with Ursula" are found in this location.
biomes.name: Ruins

biomes.description: The Secret Chamber is a Location where Olaf is first encountered.
biomes.name: Secret Chamber

biomes.description: The Secret Room is a Location. It will already be placed when beginning a new game and its entrance is found inside the Dream Castle, to the right after you enter, through some potted topiaries. Its entrance will not be revealed and cannot be entered until it is unlocked during the Mickey Mouse Level 10 Friendship quest "The Secret Door".
biomes.name: Secret Room

biomes.description: The Stardust Port is a Location found on the third floor of the Dream Castle. Its entrance will not be unlocked until the paid Expansion Pass quest The Port of Many Worlds.
biomes.name: Stardust Port

biomes.description:
The Sunlit Plateau is a savanna-like biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is located on the west side of the Valley, connected to the Plaza and Forgotten Lands. It also contains the entrance to the Vitalys Mines, which unlocks during the quest Nature & Nurture.

The thorns blocking the pathway to this biome can be cleared using 7,000 Dreamlight.
biomes.name: Sunlit Plateau

biomes.description:
Teapot Falls is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

It is the first biome the player must unlock after its subregion The Library of Lore. The Library of Lore region is unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the introductory quest.
biomes.name: Teapot Falls

biomes.description:
The Beanstalk Marshes is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

It is the first biome the player must unlock after its subregion The Library of Lore. The Library of Lore region is unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the introductory quest.
biomes.name: The Beanstalk Marshes

biomes.description:
The Bind is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

It is the first biome the player must unlock after its subregion The Library of Lore. The Library of Lore region is unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the introductory quest.
biomes.name: The Bind

biomes.description: The Elysian Fields is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.
biomes.name: The Elysian Fields

biomes.description:
The Fallen Fortress is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

It is the first biome the player must unlock after its subregion The Library of Lore. The Library of Lore region is unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the introductory quest.
biomes.name: The Fallen Fortress

biomes.description: The Fiery Plains is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.
biomes.name: The Fiery Plains

biomes.description:
The Library of Lore is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

It is the first biome the player must unlock after its subregion The Library of Lore. The Library of Lore region is unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the introductory quest.
biomes.name: The Library of Lore

biomes.description: The Statue's Shadow is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.
biomes.name: The Statue's Shadow

biomes.description:
The Wild Woods is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

It is the first biome the player must unlock after its subregion The Library of Lore. The Library of Lore region is unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the introductory quest.
biomes.name: The Wild Woods

biomes.description: The Vitalys Mine is a series of underground tunnels rich with Mining Nodes found in the Sunlit Plateau.
biomes.name: Vitalys Mine

biomes.description:
The Wild Tangle is a biome in Eternity Isle, available after purchasing the expansion A Rift in Time.

It is located on the north-east side of Eternity Isle.

The broken bridge blocking the pathway to this biome can be repaired using 2,000 Mist during the quest The Sands in the Hourglass.
biomes.name: Wild Tangle

characters.description: Aladdin is a character from the Disney film Aladdin (1992).
characters.name: Aladdin
rewards:
Diamond in the Rough Loafers
Diamond in the Rough Top
Diamond in the Rough Trousers
Diamond in the Rough Vest

characters.description: Alice is a character from the Disney film Alice in Wonderland (1951). She is unlocked after opening the Alice in Wonderland Realm, completing the quest Leaving Wonderland, and placing Alice's House.
characters.name: Alice

characters.description:
Anna is a character from the Disney films Frozen (2013), Frozen II (2019).
She's unlocked after traveling to the Frozen Realm.
characters.name: Anna

characters.description:
Ariel is a character from the Disney film The Little Mermaid (1989).
She lives in the water, which can make speaking with her difficult if she's too far from shore. After completing Prince Eric's friendship quest Part of His World, she'll be able to return to land, making speaking to her much easier.
characters.name: Ariel
rewards:
Ariel's Seafoam Gown,
Ariel's Seafoam Suit

characters.description: Aurora is a character from the Disney film Sleeping Beauty (1959). She is unlocked after completing a series of quests in the Unwritten Realms during the story part of The Storybook Vale Part 2.
characters.name: Aurora

characters.description: Belle is a character from the Disney film Beauty and the Beast (1991).
characters.name: Belle
rewards:
Royal Gold Ball Gown
Royal Gold Ballroom Suit

characters.description: Buzz Lightyear is a character from Disney and Pixar's Toy Story franchise.
characters.name: Buzz Lightyear

characters.description: Cheshire Cat is a character from the Disney film Alice in Wonderland (1951).
characters.name: Cheshire Cat

characters.description: Cinderella is a character from the Disney animated film Cinderella (1950). She can be unlocked after picking up the Lost Shoe in the Plaza, and completing the quest The Pumpkin and the Princess.
characters.name: Cinderella
rewards:
Silver Pumpkin Necklace
Pink Homespun Gown
Pink Homespun Gloves
Glass Bow Heels

characters.description: Cogsworth is a character from the film Beauty and the Beast (1991). He is unlocked after opening the Beauty and the Beast Realm during the quest A Guide to Better Castle-Keeping.
characters.name: Cogsworth

characters.description: Cruella is a character from the Disney film One Hundred and One Dalmatians (1961).
characters.name: Cruella
rewards:
Black, White, and Chic All Over Hat
Black, White, and Chic All Over Jacket

characters.description: Daisy Duck is a character from the classic Disney cartoons.
characters.name: Daisy

characters.description:
Donald Duck is a character from the classic Disney cartoons.
The player will first encounter Donald's boat-home floating on the water after unlocking Dazzle Beach. Donald himself can be found after completing the Story Quest Lost in the Dark Grove from Kristoff in the Forest of Valor.
characters.name: Donald Duck

characters.description: EVE (Extraterrestrial Vegetation Evaluator) is a character from the Disney-Pixar film WALL-E (2008).
characters.name: EVE

characters.description: Elsa is a character from the Disney films Frozen (2013), Frozen II (2019).
characters.name: Elsa

characters.description: Flynn is a character from the Disney film Tangled (2010). He is encountered during the Story quest A Sheep in Wolf's Clothing in one of the Everafter Trials.
characters.name: Flynn

characters.description: Gaston is a character from the Disney film Beauty and the Beast (1991).
characters.name: Gaston

characters.description:
Goofy is a character from the classic Disney cartoons.
When the player arrives in Dreamlight Valley Goofy already lives there and has a house located in the Peaceful Meadow.
characters.name: Goofy

characters.description: Hades is a character from the Disney film Hercules (1997). He is encountered during the Story quest Guts & Glory in one of the Mythopia Trials.
characters.name: Hades

characters.description: Jack Skellington is a character from the Disney film The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993).
characters.name: Jack Skellington

characters.description: Jafar is a character from the Disney film Aladdin (1992).
characters.name: Jafar
rewards:
Jeweled Vizier Top
Jeweled Vizier Trousers

characters.description: Jasmine is a character from the Disney film Aladdin (1992).
characters.name: Jasmine
rewards:
Desert Bloom Necklace
Desert Bloom Slip-Ons
Desert Bloom Top
Desert Bloom Trousers

characters.description: Joy is a character from the Disney-Pixar film Inside Out (2015). She is unlocked after opening the Inside Out Realm, and placing her home during the quest Dream On!.
characters.name: Joy
rewards:
Joyful Retro Hat
Joyful Retro Outfit

characters.description:
Kristoff is a character from the 2013 Disney film Frozen.
He's available to unlock after clearing the path to the Forest of Valor.
characters.name: Kristoff

characters.description: Lumiere is a character from the film Beauty and the Beast (1991). He is unlocked after opening the Beauty and the Beast Realm during the quest A Guide to Better Castle-Keeping.
characters.name: Lumiere
rewards:
Elegant Stage Necklace
Ruffled Stage Dress
Ruffled Stage Shoes

characters.description: Maleficent is a character from the Disney film Sleeping Beauty (1959). She is a currently a non-resident of the Valley, and although she offers a story related quest on The Storybook Vale, she does not (yet) have a house, friendship level or rewards.
characters.name: Maleficent

characters.description:
Maui is a character from the film Moana (2016).
He's encountered after travelling through one of the initial three realm gates to the Moana Realm, and can be invited to the Valley after completing his necessary quests and placing/purchasing his home.
characters.name: Maui

characters.description: Merida is a character from the Disney-Pixar film Brave (2012). She is encountered in the first biome in The Storybook Vale, The Bind.
characters.name: Merida

characters.description:
Merlin is a character from the Disney film The Sword in the Stone (1963).
He is the first villager players encounter when beginning the game.
characters.name: Merlin

characters.description:
Mickey Mouse is a character from the classic Disney cartoons.
When the player arrives in Dreamlight Valley Mickey already lives there and has a home in the Plaza.
characters.name: Mickey Mouse

characters.description: Mike Wazowski is a character from the Disney-Pixar film Monsters, Inc. (2001).
characters.name: Mike Wazowski

characters.description: Minnie Mouse is a character from the classic Disney cartoons.
characters.name: Minnie Mouse

characters.description:
Mirabel Madrigal is a character from the 2021 animated film Encanto.
She is unlocked after completing The Golden Doorknob quest and placing Mini-Casita anywhere in the Valley.
characters.name: Mirabel
rewards:
Teal Dreamlore Poncho,
Emerald Dreamlore Skirt

characters.description:
Moana is a character from the film Moana (2016).
She's encountered after travelling through one of the initial three realm gates to the Moana Realm, and can be invited to the Valley after completing her necessary quests and placing/purchasing her home.
characters.name: Moana

characters.description: Mother Gothel is a character from the Disney film Tangled (2010).
characters.name: Mother Gothel

characters.description: Mulan is a character from the Disney film Mulan (1998).
characters.name: Mulan

characters.description: Mushu is a character from the Disney film Mulan (1998).
characters.name: Mushu

characters.description: Nala is a character from the Disney film The Lion King (1994).
characters.name: Nala

characters.description:
Olaf is a character from the Disney films Frozen (2013), Frozen II (2019).
He can be found in a cave at Frosted Heights
characters.name: Olaf

characters.description: Oswald is a character from several animated short films under the series "Oswald the Lucky Rabbit" released to theaters from 1927 to 1938, and is notable as one of Walt Disney's early creations prior to creating Mickey Mouse.
characters.name: Oswald

characters.description: Peter Pan is a character from the Disney film Peter Pan (1953).
characters.name: Peter Pan

characters.description: Prince Eric is a character from the Disney film The Little Mermaid (1989).
characters.name: Prince Eric

characters.description: Pumbaa is a character from the Disney film The Lion King (1994). He is unlocked after opening The Lion King Realm, and completing the quest Where's Pumbaa?.
characters.name: Pumbaa

characters.description: Rapunzel is a character from the Disney film Tangled (2010).
characters.name: Rapunzel
rewards:
Glowing Floral Gown
Glowing Floral Suit

characters.description:
Remy is a character from the Pixar film Ratatouille (2007).
He's encountered after travelling through one of the initial three realm gates, the Ratatouille Realm, and can be invited to the Valley after completing his necessary quests and placing/purchasing his home.
characters.name: Remy

characters.description: Sadness is a character from the Disney-Pixar film Inside Out (2015). She is unlocked after opening the Inside Out Realm, and completing the quest Get Up and Glow!
characters.name: Sadness

characters.description: Sally is a character from the film The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993). She is unlocked after completing the quest The Woven Bridge.
characters.name: Sally
rewards:
Patchwork Elegance Gown
Web Lace Gloves

characters.description:
Scar is a character from the Disney film The Lion King (1994).
He's encountered after unlocking the Sunlit Plateau and completing the story quest The Curse from Mother Gothel.
characters.name: Scar

characters.description:
Scrooge McDuck is a character from the classic Disney cartoons.
When the player arrives in Dreamlight Valley Scrooge already lives there and has a store in the Plaza. Scrooge provides the player options to purchase and upgrade wells, stalls, and character houses as well as operating a store with a daily rotating stock of clothing and items.
characters.name: Scrooge McDuck

characters.description: Simba is a character from the Disney film The Lion King (1994).
characters.name: Simba

characters.description: Snow White is a character from the Disney film Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937).
characters.name: Snow White

characters.description: Stitch, also known as Experiment 626, is a character from the 2002 animated film Lilo & Stitch and its franchise.
characters.name: Stitch

characters.description: Sulley is a character from the Disney-Pixar film Monsters, Inc. (2001).
characters.name: Sulley

characters.description: The Beast is a character from the Disney film Beauty and the Beast (1991).
characters.name: The Beast
rewards: The Beast's Royal Blue Brocade Suit

characters.description: The Fairy Godmother is a character from the Disney film Cinderella (1950).
characters.name: The Fairy Godmother

characters.description: The Forgotten is a character original to Disney Dreamlight Valley, is the main antagonist of Act 1 of the game's story, and is responsible for the Forgetting that has darkened the Valley and erased the Villager's memories.
characters.name: The Forgotten

characters.description: The Lorekeeper is a character original to Disney Dreamlight Valley, and is the Player's guide through The Storybook Vale expansion pass, helping them to defeat the Neverafter
characters.name: The Lorekeeper

characters.description: Tiana is a character from the film The Princess and the Frog (2009). She can be unlocked after picking up the Mysterious Cajun Recipe Book in the Glade of Trust, and completing the quest A Taste for Literature.
characters.name: Tiana
rewards:
Green Flapper Dress
Green Vintage Waistcoat

characters.description: Tigger is a character from the classic Disney series Winnie the Pooh.
characters.name: Tigger
rewards:
Tiggerific Bucket Hat
"Only One" Tigger Jersey
Tigger-Striped Pants

characters.description: Timon is a character from the Disney film The Lion King (1994). He is unlocked after opening The Lion King Realm, and completing the quest Where's Pumbaa?.
characters.name: Timon

characters.description: Tinker Bell is a character from the Disney film Peter Pan (1953).
characters.name: Tinker Bell

characters.description: Ursula is a character from the Disney film The Little Mermaid (1989).
characters.name: Ursula

characters.description: Vanellope is a character from the Disney film Wreck-It Ralph (2012).
characters.name: Vanellope

characters.description:
WALL-E (Waste Allocation Load Lifter: Earth-Class) is a character from the Disney-Pixar film WALL-E (2008).
He's encountered after travelling through one of the initial three realm gates to the WALL-E Realm, and can be invited to the Valley after completing his necessary quests and placing/purchasing his home.
characters.name: WALL-E

characters.description: Woody is a character from Disney and Pixar's Toy Story franchise.
characters.name: Woody

digging.description: An orange rock that could be great for making jewelry.
digging.name: Amber

digging.description: Looks like somebody already ate this fish. But perhaps you could use these to build something...
digging.name: Bones

digging.description: Can be found on Dazzle Beach. Go and explore!
digging.name: Clam

digging.description: This can be made into all sorts of objects.
digging.name: Clay

digging.description: A crystallized form of Dreamlight magic.
digging.name: Dream Shard

digging.description: These magical bubbles can be found buried around Everafter.
digging.name: Fairy Bubbles

digging.description: Old rubble found scattered throughout Mythopia.
digging.name: Gravel

digging.description: Perfectly suitable for mud pies or a fancy spa day and everything in between.
digging.name: Mud

digging.description: The opposite of a Dream Shard. Be careful.
digging.name: Night Shard

digging.description: Shiny, colorful glass weathered by time.
digging.name: Oasis Glass

digging.description: Pearl is a foraged material that can be found when digging the ground in all areas of Ancient's Landing.
digging.name: Pearl

digging.description: You need a lot of pebbles to make a mountain...
digging.name: Pebbles

digging.description: An important item for building sand castles.
digging.name: Sand

digging.description: Can be found on Dazzle Beach. Go and explore!
digging.name: Scallop

digging.description: Whatever you do, fight the urge to throw it.
digging.name: Snowball

digging.description: A clump of soil that's perfect for gardening.
digging.name: Soil

digging.description: This gray-black rock seems oddly porous and may even float.
digging.name: Volcanic Rock

fishing.description: Bony fish with large mouths and sharp teeth!
fishing.name: Anglerfish

fishing.description: Bass can be found just about everywhere in the Meadow.
fishing.name: Bass

fishing.description: Bones is a foraged material which can be found when digging the ground in any area in the Glittering Dunes or fishing open water in the Plains, Wastes, and Borderlands areas of the Glittering Dunes.
fishing.name: Bones

fishing.description: Silver-hued fish common in mountain streams.
fishing.name: Bream

fishing.description: This starfish would make a fine addition to any sandcastle.
fishing.name: Brilliant Blue Starfish

fishing.description: A common freshwater fish.
fishing.name: Carp

fishing.description: A large fish with cat-like "whiskers."
fishing.name: Catfish

fishing.description: A common fish that prefers cold water.
fishing.name: Cod

fishing.description: A tough little crustacean with sharp claws.
fishing.name: Crab

fishing.description: If times get tough, this fish inflates its balloon-like lungs to float up and glide down sand dunes to the next available water source.
fishing.name: Dunebopper

fishing.description: A single zap from one of these could power a whole city. Watch out...
fishing.name: Electric Eel

fishing.description: Some say that this fish fell in love with the sky and was gifted the ability to fly for just enough time to renew its love.
fishing.name: Flying Fish

fishing.description: These fish inflate themselves when threatened!
fishing.name: Fugu

fishing.description: Just because it doesn't look delicious doesn't mean it can't be part of a delicious meal.
fishing.name: Here and There Fish

fishing.description: These silver darlings travel in great numbers.
fishing.name: Herring

fishing.description: Cousin to the hooved Hippocampus, this one thought that fins work just fine for an aquatic life.
fishing.name: Hippocampus

fishing.description: A mackerel found in warmer ocean waters.
fishing.name: Kingfish

fishing.description: These fancy carp are rumored to have scales made from enchanted Star Coins.
fishing.name: Koi

fishing.description: Though intimidating, the lamprey's mouth gapes wider the more it searches for friendship.
fishing.name: Lamprey

fishing.description: Long, slender fish with a large silver dorsal fin.
fishing.name: Lancetfish

fishing.description: Larger than crabs, but still with sharp claws!
fishing.name: Lobster

fishing.description: This tasty mollusk is surprisingly good at filtering water.
fishing.name: Mussel

fishing.description: This soft-bodied mollusk makes up for its lack of a shell by having a genius brain.
fishing.name: Octopus

fishing.description: A rare fish found only in a special spot.
fishing.name: Perch

fishing.description: An olive green fish found in lakes and rivers.
fishing.name: Pike

fishing.description: This little guy is cute, but watch out for those teeth.
fishing.name: Piranha

fishing.description: A very big fish with some very red scales.
fishing.name: Pirarucu

fishing.description: While it may look like garbage, it could be used to make something more.
fishing.name: Plastic Scrap

fishing.description: This aquatic plant's fiery hue puts more sedate seaweed to shame.
fishing.name: Posidonia

fishing.description: This starfish adds a bit of pink to any beach.
fishing.name: Pretty Pink Starfish

fishing.description: You've never seen such a shrimp. Hopefully it tastes just as good as the classic-looking one.
fishing.name: Prisma Shrimp

fishing.description: Its unique scales give the fish its name.
fishing.name: Rainbow Trout

fishing.description: This rare creeping algae can be found in bodies of water across Dreamlight Valley. You think it might be able to help improve your Royal Fishing Rod somehow.
fishing.name: Red Algae

fishing.description: Be careful when eating this. You might end up with some nuts and bolts stuck between your teeth.
fishing.name: Robot Fish

fishing.description: A common fish found just about everywhere!
fishing.name: Salmon

fishing.description: Salt brings out the best in any dish. Best served alongside its friend: pepper.
fishing.name: Salt Crystal

fishing.description: This fish may not look very pretty, but that doesn't mean it wouldn't be delicious with a bit of butter and a little spice.
fishing.name: Sand Fish

fishing.description: This insect slithers under the sand of the Glittering Dunes.
fishing.name: Sand Worm

fishing.description: These scales must have fallen off some very beautiful fish. Now maybe you could use them to make something equally beautiful...
fishing.name: Scales

fishing.description: This creature is dangerous from both the front and the back.
fishing.name: Scorpion

fishing.description: A very edible sea alga.
fishing.name: Sea Grapes

fishing.description: Perhaps some ancient sea beasts still swim the borders of the Vale...
fishing.name: Scales

fishing.description: This snail leaves a tiny trail of stars behind it as it crawls. It looks just like the Milky Way.
fishing.name: Sea Snail

fishing.description: These deep hunters will give an uncanny aquatic howl when the moon is visible underwater.
fishing.name: Sea Wolf

fishing.description: A type of algae found in the ocean.
fishing.name: Seaweed

fishing.description: A slightly sweet, slightly salty fish that makes a great centerpiece for any dish.
fishing.name: Shad

fishing.description: Crustaceans that eat food off the ocean floor.
fishing.name: Shrimp

fishing.description: This fish is clearly the product of some sort of horrible magical experiment. But maybe it could be made into something delicious.
fishing.name: Skeleton Fish

fishing.description: A flatfish that is shaped like a tongue!

gardening.description: Asparagus is a perennial flowering plant species in the genus Asparagus. It was originally native to most of Europe, northern Africa, and western Asia, but has been cultivated worldwide as a food crop.
gardening.name: Asparagus

gardening.description: A grain that grows in temperate climates, this is perfect for making bread or giving a bit of starch to a stew.
gardening.name: Barley

gardening.description: The magical fruit.
gardening.name: Beans

gardening.description: Bell pepper is a cultivar group of the species Capsicum annuum. Cultivated varieties are grouped into three colors: green, yellow, and red.
gardening.name: Bell Pepper

gardening.description: This will bring a bit of spice to any dish. Best served with its friend: salt.
gardening.name: Black Pepper

gardening.description: If you arrange a bunch of them, they sort of look like a tiny forest.
gardening.name: Broccoli

gardening.description: Use it to make a nice salad... or put a hat on it and turn it into a scarecrow.
gardening.name: Cabbage

gardening.description: Canola is dairy and oil type ingredient used in cooking. It can be grown from Canola Seed, which is purchased from Goofy's Stall in the Forest of Valor.
gardening.name: Canola

gardening.description: The carrot (Daucus carota) is a root vegetable often claimed to be the perfect health food. It is crunchy, tasty, and highly nutritious. Carrots are a particularly good source of beta carotene, fiber, vitamin K1, potassium, and antioxidants ( 1 ). They also have a number of health benefits.
gardening.name: Carrot

gardening.description: Every piece of a cauliflower looks like another tiny cauliflower.
gardening.name: Cauliflower

gardening.description: Perfect for dipping in some cheese or chopping up and throwing in a stir-fry.
gardening.name: Celery

gardening.description: Sprinkle a little of this over your yogurt to give it that extra special something.
gardening.name: Chia Seeds

gardening.description: A Chili pepper is the fruit of plants from the genus Capsicum, members of the nightshade family, Solanaceae. In Britain, Australia, Ireland, New Zealand, South Africa, India, and other English-speaking countries, the term chili pepper is used to describe all spicy peppers, regardless of species.
gardening.name: Chili Pepper

gardening.description: Corn is a tall annual cereal grass (Zea mays) that is widely grown for its large elongated ears of starchy seeds. The seeds, which are also known as corn, are used as food for humans and livestock and as a source of biofuel and can be processed into a wide range of useful chemicals.
gardening.name: Corn

gardening.description: The outside of this luscious fruit looks like the night sky, but the inside is bursting with a tiny nebula.
gardening.name: Cosmic Figs

gardening.description: Soft fluff that can be used in lots of stuff!
gardening.name: Cotton

gardening.description: Cucumber is a highly refreshing vegetable thanks to its water content, it has a low content of lipids, carbohydrates and proteins. The great vitamin C and B9 content is the most outstanding characteristic, along with its laxative properties and its capacity to relieve kidney disorders.
gardening.name: Cucumber

gardening.description: Nutritionally, eggplant is low in fat, protein, and carbohydrates. It contains relatively low amounts of numerous vitamins and minerals, such as B1, B6, folate, copper, manganese, potassium and one cup of the skin and flesh provides approximately 10 percent of the daily value of fiber.
gardening.name: Eggplant

gardening.description: A slightly unusual rye, with just a hint of fae magic to it.
gardening.name: Faerie Rye

gardening.description: Legend has it these starchy roots taste even better if you whistle a tune on them before cooking.
gardening.name: Flute Root

gardening.description: Nature's candy, fresh off the vine.
gardening.name: Grapes

gardening.description: They're green. They're beans. It doesn't need to be any more complicated than that.
gardening.name: Green Beans

gardening.description: Beneath that yellow rind, this melon is as sweet as honey and succulent as the morning dew.
gardening.name: Honeydew Melon

gardening.description: Description. The leek is a member of the onion family, but unlike the onion, it does not form a bulb. The thick, fleshy stalk is about the same diameter at the base and resembles a large green onion without a bulb. Leaves are flattened like those of garlic.
gardening.name: Leek

gardening.description: lettuce, (Lactuca sativa), annual leaf vegetable of the aster family (Asteraceae). Most lettuce varieties are eaten fresh and are commonly served as the base of green salads. Lettuce is generally a rich source of vitamins K and A, though the nutritional quality varies, depending on the variety.
gardening.name: Lettuce

gardening.description: It's big, it's round, and it's delicious. What more could you want from a melon?
gardening.name: Melon

gardening.description: Perfect for making oatmeal or adding a little crunch to yogurt.
gardening.name: Oats

gardening.description: Okra—also known as lady's-fingers, gumbo, or bhindi—is the most important vegetable crop of the tropical and subtropical regions of the world. It belongs to the genus Abelmoschus and family Malvaceae. Okra is a multipurpose crop valued for its tender and delicious pods.
gardening.name: Okra

gardening.description: Onion, Herbaceous biennial plant (Allium cepa) of the family Alliaceae, probably native to southwestern Asia but now grown worldwide, and its edible bulb. Among the hardiest and oldest garden vegetable plants, onions bear a cluster of small, greenish white flowers on one or more leafless stalks.
gardening.name: Onion

gardening.description: Don't let that tough, spiky exterior fool you. They're actually very sweet!
gardening.name: Pineapple

gardening.description: The potato is a starchy food, a tuber of the plant Solanum tuberosum and is a root vegetable native to the Americas. The plant is a perennial in the nightshade family Solanaceae. Potato cultivars appear in a variety of colors, shapes, and sizes.
gardening.name: Potato

gardening.description: Pumpkin is a plump, nutritious orange vegetable, and a highly nutrient dense food. It is low in calories but rich in vitamins and minerals, all of which are also in its seeds, leaves, and juices.
gardening.name: Pumpkin

gardening.description: It would be ridiculous not to like radicchio.
gardening.name: Radicchio

gardening.description: A root vegetable that will really spice up your salad.
gardening.name: Radish

gardening.description: An excellent addition to any strawberry pie.
gardening.name: Rhubarb

gardening.description: Rice, Edible starchy cereal grain and the annual grass (Oryza sativa, family Poaceae) that produces it. Roughly one-half of the world's population, including almost all of East and Southeast Asia, depends on rice as its principal staple food.
gardening.name: Rice

gardening.description: It's sort of like a pumpkin, but a little bit squashed.
gardening.name: Ring Squash

gardening.description: A handful of these may look like rare gems, but they're much tastier (and more economical) in soups and stews.
gardening.name: Ruby Lentils

gardening.description: soybean, (Glycine max), also called soja bean or soya bean, annual legume of the pea family (Fabaceae) and its edible seed. The soybean is economically the most important bean in the world, providing vegetable protein for millions of people and ingredients for hundreds of chemical products.
gardening.name: Soya

gardening.description: Spinach (Spinacia oleracea) is a leafy green vegetable that originated in Persia. It belongs to the amaranth family and is related to beets and quinoa. What's more, it's considered very healthy, as it's loaded with nutrients and antioxidants. There are many ways to prepare spinach.
gardening.name: Spinach

gardening.description: Sugar cane is a tropical grass that grows 10–20 feet high. Unlike sugar beets, it's perennial, meaning it doesn't need to be replanted every year. When harvested, sugar cane is cut just above the root level so new sprouts will grow, ready to be harvested again in 10–12 months.
gardening.name: Sugarcane

gardening.description: The tomato (Solanum lycopersicum) is a fruit from the nightshade family native to South America. Despite botanically being a fruit, it's generally eaten and prepared like a vegetable. They are a great source of vitamin C, potassium, folate, and vitamin K.
gardening.name: Tomato

gardening.description: A few of these are sure to "turnip" whenever you need to make a tasty meal.
gardening.name: Turnip

gardening.description: Wheat is a valuable source of essential nutrients, providing carbohydrate-based energy and fiber, protein, B vitamins, calcium, magnesium, phosphorus, potassium, zinc, and iron. In low and medium-income countries, grain-based foods still make up the central part of the diet.
gardening.name: Wheat

gardening.description: I yam what I yam.
gardening.name: Yam

gardening.description: Zucchini is a low-calorie, high volume vegetable with plenty of vitamins B6 and C. It's also a good source of potassium, folate, and vitamin A. Zucchini is considered a low-carbohydrate vegetable with plenty of fiber.
gardening.name: Zucchini

mining.description: A rare crystal that can be mined.
mining.name: Shiny Tourmaline

mining.description: Spinel is a gem which can be found when mining rock nodes using the Pickaxe in The Promenade and The Grove areas of the Wild Tangle.
mining.name: Spinel

mining.description: This rare form of sapphire has crystallized into a star shape.
mining.name: Star Sapphire

mining.description: Some imagination can turn stone into art.
mining.name: Stone

mining.description: An orange mineral that can be mined.
mining.name: Topaz

mining.description: A crystal that can be mined.
mining.name: Tourmaline

mining.description: This crystal from the Vitalys Mines is infused with life. Throw it together with a few other magical Ingredients and you may be able to improve your Royal Tools.
mining.name: Vitalys Crystal

poi.description: The Cursed Cave or Mysterious Cave is a Location where Ursula is first encountered.
poi.name: Cursed Cave

poi.description: The Dark Castle is a Location accessed through a portal during the The Dark Castle. Is a darker version of the Dream Castle, with night thorns obstructing the stairs, shattered pillars, and other rubble strewn about.
poi.name: Dark Castle

poi.description:
The Dark Grove is a location where Donald Duck is encountered during the Story Quest Lost in the Dark Grove. It can be accessed through a portal found in the southwest corner of the Forest of Valor, where Kristoff will be standing outside.

To reach the Dark Grove, the Player must select Enter on the dark portal in the Forest of Valor after unlocking the biome. After the quest Lost in the Dark Grove is complete the portal will close and the Dark Grove can no longer be accessed.
poi.name: Dark Grove

poi.description:
The Deserted Island is a Location where Ariel is first encountered during her Friendship Quest The Lonely Island. It will already be placed when beginning a new game and its entrance is found in the southeast quadrant of Dazzle Beach, on the island near the Skull Rock.
To reach the island, the Player must Embark on the raft repaired during the quest The Mysterious Wreck.
poi.name: Dark Grove

poi.description: The Dreamscape is a Location accessed through a portal inside a treehouse disguised as a large rock in the Forgotten Lands during the quest Miracles Take Time.
poi.name: Dreamscape

poi.description: The Elephant Graveyard is a Location. It is a specific region of the Sunlit Plateau decorated with bones and foggy lighting effects. The Giant Skull is originally found in this location.
poi.name: Elephant Graveyard

poi.description: The Herbalist Room is a Location. It cannot be entered until it is unlocked during the Simba Level 7 Friendship quest "Seed of Memories".
poi.name: Herbalist Room

poi.description:
Kristoff's Stall is a stall operated by Kristoff.
It sells a variety of foraged resources and refined materials. The stock cycles daily. Only limited quantities of each resource may be purchased per day.
poi.name: Kristoff's Stall

poi.description: The Mystical Cave is a Location. It is a dark, mysterious cave that has 4 levels descending into the earth, with a pool of water and broken pillars at the lowest level.
poi.name: Mystical Cave

poi.description: The Ruins are a Location. It is a specific region of the Forgotten Lands. The Pedestals used in the Ursula Level 10 Friendship quest "A Deal with Ursula" are found in this location.
poi.name: Ruins

poi.description: The Secret Chamber is a Location where Olaf is first encountered.
poi.name: Secret Chamber

poi.description: The Secret Room is a Location. It will already be placed when beginning a new game and its entrance is found inside the Dream Castle, to the right after you enter, through some potted topiaries. Its entrance will not be revealed and cannot be entered until it is unlocked during the Mickey Mouse Level 10 Friendship quest "The Secret Door".
poi.name: Secret Room

poi.description: The Stardust Port is a Location found on the third floor of the Dream Castle. Its entrance will not be unlocked until the paid Expansion Pass quest The Port of Many Worlds.
poi.name: Stardust Port

poi.description: The Vitalys Mine is a series of underground tunnels rich with Mining Nodes found in the Sunlit Plateau.
poi.name: Vitalys Mine

quests.name: name
objectives: Objective 1

quests.name: Good As Gold
objectives: Talk to Scrooge McDuck about testing his shop's new security system.

  ‧ Ways to make quick escapes from guards
Talk to Aladdin.

Dress up in clothing that's:

Go inside Scrooge McDuck's General Store.
Follow Aladdin inside Scrooge McDuck's General Store.
To begin Scrooge McDuck's security system test, go inside his shop and press the button on the wall beside the counter.
Talk to Aladdin inside Scrooge McDuck's General Store.
Push the button on the upstairs table in Scrooge McDuck's General Store.

Deactivate Scrooge McDuck's security system by pressing the button located on the wall behind the counter.

The vault shut, and a bunch of enchanted coins escaped! Catch them! 4 coins
Make sure you have every Flying Coin in your Inventory
Bring every Flying Coin to Aladdin.
Go to Dreamlight Valley.
Catch every remaining Flying Coin throughout the Valley
Go inside Aladdin and Jasmine's House.
Make sure you have every Flying Coin in your Inventory
Give every Flying Coin you caught to Aladdin.
Take a picture of Aladdin with Scrooge McDuck's coins.
Listen to Aladdin and Scrooge McDuck discuss the heist in the Valley.
Talk to Aladdin.

  ‧ Flynn.
  ‧ Mother Gothel.

The party is not over!

quests.name: Guts & Glory
objectives: Enter the Mythic Trial in the Elysian Fields. (Note: Until certain quest progress has been made, this step can not successfully trigger as completed.)
Explore the first Mythic Trial.
Push Hades' cart.
Follow Hades.
Find a way to rotate the bridge.
Cross the bridge.
Find a way to open the gates and push the cart through.
Follow Hades.
Figure out how to release the bridge.
Follow Hades.
Find a way to rotate the bridge.
Explore deeper in the Mythic Trial.
Find a way to open the gates and move the cart along.
Follow Hades.
Talk to Hades.
Interact with the source of the corruption inside the first Mythic Trial.
Talk to Hades.
Place Hades' Lair anywhere in the Storybook Vale.
Unlock Hades' Lair by interacting with the Scrooge McDuck sign next to it.
Welcome Hades to the Vale!
Check in with Hades.

quests.name: A Moth to a Flame
objectives:
You've cleared away the ink blocking the way, and discovered a new part of Mythopia.
  ‧ Explore the Fiery Plains.

Mysterious flames block the path!
  ‧ Take a picture of them.

If only there were someone knowledgeable about Mythopia who could help you...
  ‧ Explore the Elysian Fields to find a Villager who can help you.
Talk to Hades and show him the picture of the Mysterious Flames.

Hades talked about a hidden spring of sacred water with magical properties.
  ‧ Talk to The Lorekeeper about its location.

The Lorekeeper holds a story about the Sacred Spring's location. Collect enough Snippets to restore it to her pages.
  ‧ 10 Red Bird Snippet.
  ‧ 5 Pink Demon Snippet.
  ‧ 2 Blue Demon Snippet.
Reorder the "Aurora and the Sacred Spring" Tale in the Lorekeeper's pages.
Find the Sacred Spring hidden in Storybook Vale using the clues from Aurora's story.

You found the Sacred Spring!
  ‧ Pick up a vial of the sacred water.
Return to Hades.

Gather the following in Mythopia:
  ‧ 5 Crimson Eternal Poppies.
  ‧ 3 Magma.
  ‧ 2 Hippocampus.
Craft the Watering Can Potion.
Use the Watering Can Potion from your Inventory.

You can now use your Watering Can to remove the Mysterious Flames!
  ‧ Reach the Mythic Trial in the Fiery Plains and use your Royal Net to activate it.

quests.name: Mount Olympus
objectives: Explore Mount Olympus.

Explore Mythopia and complete the three Mythic Trials to reach Mount Olympus.
  ‧ Guts & Glory.
  ‧ The Promethean Flame.
  ‧ Losing Your Marbles.
Enter Mount Olympus.
Find Hades and talk to him.
Find two more Vases deeper in Mount Olympus.
Find a way to open the first gates.
Follow Hades.
Find a way to rotate the platform.
Follow Hades.

Hades and You labored to find the vases to help them reach their goals.
  ‧ Find two more Vases deeper in Mount Olympus.
Lower the bridge.
Cross the bridge.
Find a way to open the second gate.
Follow Hades.
Find a way to raise the first gate.
Follow Hades.
Find a way to open the second drawbridge.
Cross the drawbridge.
Follow Hades.
Find a way to raise the second gate.
Find two more Vases deeper in Mount Olympus.
Follow Hades.
Find a way to open the third gate.
Capture the Demon Snippet inside the throne room.

More Snippets have appeared!
  ‧ Capture the 2 Demon Snippets inside the throne room.
Talk to Hades.

quests.name: The Promethean Flame
objectives: Enter the Mythic Trial in the Fiery Plains.
Talk to Hades.
Move 3Flaming Torch to the correct place.
Return to Hades.

quests.name: Losing Your Marbles
objectives: Enter the Mythic Trial beneath the statue of Hades.
Find Hades and speak with him.
Pull the lever to lower the drawbridge

Whoops... That didn't work so well...
  ‧ Talk to Hades.
Find a way to hold up the drawbridge.
Talk to Hades.
Follow Hades.
Try pulling the lever again.
Follow Hades.
Turn the rotating platform.

Talk to Hades.
  ‧ Uh-oh. The platform spins all the way around with nothing to stop it...
Find a way to block the rotation of the bridge.
Follow Hades.
Turn the rotating platform.
Explore deeper in the Mythic Trial.
Push the cart.
Follow Hades.
Interact with the source of the corruption inside the first Mythic Trial.

quests.name: The Pumpkin King Returns
objectives: Talk to Olaf.
Prepare some fresh Chocolate Ice Cream for Olaf.
Make sure you have the Chocolate Ice Cream in your Inventory.
Bring the Chocolate Ice Cream to Olaf.
Talk to Jack Skellington.
Go see Ursula to introduce her to Jack Skellington.

  ‧ 3 Red Nasturtium.
  ‧ 3 White Passion Lily.
  ‧ 2 Amethyst.
Bring what you've gathered to Ursula.
Talk to Jack Skellington.
Follow Jack Skellington and listen to what he has to say.
Talk to Jack Skellington.

Gather the following materials:

  ‧ 10 Dark Wood.
Craft a throne for the Pumpkin King.
Place the Pumpkin King's Throne anywhere in the Valley.
Take a picture of the Pumpkin King's Throne with Jack Skellington.
Show the picture to Jack Skellington.

quests.name: The Scientific Method
objectives: Head inside the Vitalys Mines.
Find Jack Skellington in the Vitalys Mines.

Gather the following materials:

Bring the Night Shards to Jack Skellington in the Vitalys Mines.

Find each potion in Merlin's Library.

  ‧ Green Potion.

A Night Thorn Sprout appeared. Pick it up.
Bring the Night Thorn Sprout to Jack Skellington.

quests.name: The Holiday Poll
objectives:
Talk to the following Villagers:

  ‧ A Holiday Treat for Vanellope.

quests.name: Dreamlight Day
objectives:
Decorate the Forgotten Lands, the Sunlit Plateau or the Peaceful Meadow with:

Dreamlight Day Banner.

Talk to Jack Skellington

Figure out how to remove the 8 Candy Skulls inside Vanellope's House.

Remove the 6 Vegetable Antelope inside Scar's House.

Find and remove the cursed book by using your Camera:

Talk to Minnie.

Embrace the Oogie Boogie Fan Club by:

Talk to Jack Skellington.
rewards: Motif Bag containing four unique motifs

quests.name: The Optics of a Second Chance
objectives:
Find Jafar's tools in the Cave of Wonders.

Search in EVE's House for:
  ‧ 3 Power Cables.

Make sure you have all of Jafar's tools:

  ‧ 2 Photonic Lever.
  ‧ 3 Power Cables.
Bring Jafar's tools back to him.

Find Gems on Eternity Isle:

  ‧ Spinel.
  ‧ Bumblestone.
  ‧ Alexandrite.
  ‧ Evergem.
Craft the Dimensional Prism.
Meet Jafar at his Laboratory in the Palace.
Talk to Jafar in his Laboratory.

Install everything for the experiment:
  ‧ Plug in the cables from the Power Coil to the Door.
Open the Experiment Chamber using the door lever.
Place the Dimensional Prism on the Pedestal.
Enter the Experiment Chamber and install the Geometrically Impaired Objects in the Experiment Slots.

Proceed with Jafar's optics experiment:
  ‧ Close the door.

Proceed with Jafar's optics experiment:
  ‧ Activate the power lever near the Mirror.

Open the door to the Experiment Chamber and gather the repaired items:

quests.name: The Alchemical Revolution
objectives: Find Iron Ore to bring to EVE

Meet Jafar in his laboratory.
Return to Jafar's Laboratory.
Talk to Jafar about the next Alchemical step.

Make sure you have the Alchemical Gold in your Inventory.
Give the Alchemical Gold to Jafar.

Make sure you have all the unique Alchemical Ingredients in your Inventory:

  ‧ Mini Holiday Tree.
  ‧ Book of Fairy Magic.
Return to Jafar's Laboratory in the Palace.

Make sure you have in your Inventory:
  ‧ Ancient Sand-Polished Stone.
  ‧ Mini Holiday Tree.
  ‧ Book of Fairy Magic.
Give the Alchemical Ingredients to Jafar.

Mix Minor Essences to brew the Major Essences for the Gilded Stone (Use any combination of 3 Minor Essences from the resource table).

  ‧ Essence of Wonder.
  ‧ Essence of Wishes.

Make sure you have the 3 Major Essences:
  ‧ Major Essence of Will.
  ‧ Major Essence of Wonder.

Bring the 3 Major Essences to Jafar.
Return to the Alchemy Table in Jafar's Laboratory.
Try to create the Gilded Stone using your 3 Major Essences.
Make sure you have the Mysterious Stone in your Inventory.

Seek the Emotive Essences by:

Look around the center Wishing Well on Eternity Isle for:

Show the Emotive Essences to Jafar.

quests.name: The Serpent's Gift
objectives:
Decorate with Jafar's Imagination Generators in:

  ‧ Borderlands.

Wait 10 minutes for Jafar's machines to start working.
Talk to Oswald to see if Jafar's machines cheered him up.
Cook up a Poutine for Oswald.
Bring the Poutine to Oswald to fill him up.

Oswald is still feeling odd. Check up on other Villagers.
  ‧ Gaston.
  ‧ Scrooge McDuck.
  ‧ Rapunzel.
Everyone is acting strangely — maybe check in with EVE.

Investigate the three Villagers' homes for whatever Jafar planted.
  ‧ Rapunzel's Tower.
  ‧ Gaston's Lodge.
  ‧ Scrooge McDuck's Store.

Make sure everyone is feeling normal once more:
  ‧ Listen to Rapunzel and Scrooge McDuck just outside Scrooge's Store.

Make sure everyone is feeling normal once more:
  ‧ Check in with Gaston.

Investigate the Ancient Ruins.
  ‧ Search for Jafar's secret machine.
Confront Jafar about his sinister plot.
Find the 3 power sources to Jafar's Machines and short-circuit them with your Royal Watering Can.
Break 3 Jafar's Machines using your Pickaxe while Jafar is distracted.
Check in with Oswald.
Confront Jafar.

quests.name: The Trial of Eternity
objectives:
Prepare for the Trial with the Villagers:

  ‧ Gaston.
  ‧ Oswald.
  ‧ Remy.
  ‧ EVE.

-2 Attorney Stands.

Make sure you have:
  ‧ 2 Attorney Stands.
  ‧ 2 Benches.
Bring the Trial furniture to Gaston.
Check in with Oswald about his hunt for a Dreamlight Judge.

Dress up like a fancy Judge using:

(Optional: Order the Commodore's Powdered Wig from Scrooge McDuck's Store).
Return to the Ancient Ruins to begin the Trial.

Begin the Trial:
  ‧ Go near the Judge's Chair in the Ancient Ruins.
  ‧ Let Scrooge and Jafar debate.
Talk to Gaston to hear his testimony.
Listen to the debate in the courtroom.

Let Oswald come to the Witness Stand next.
  ‧ Stay near the Judge's Chair in the Ancient Ruins.

Let Oswald come to the Witness Stand next.
  ‧ Talk to Oswald and hear his testimony.

Use the Royal Hourglass to track down good memories of Jafar in:
  ‧ The Borderlands.
  ‧ The Lagoon.
  ‧ The Overlook.
Return to your Judge's chair in the courtroom in the Ancient Ruins.
Give your final judgement to Jafar.

quests.name: Making Amends
objectives: Wait 1 hour for Jafar to reflect on his sentence.

Guide Jafar to goodness by cooking some tasty meals:

  ‧ Makrout.
  ‧ Shish Taouk.

Make sure you have Jafar's favorite meals in your Inventory.
  ‧ Falafel.
  ‧ Makrout.
  ‧ Shish Taouk.
Bring the meals to Jafar.

  ‧ A Cobra.
  ‧ A Capybara.

  ‧ Rapunzel.
  ‧ Oswald.

Place the Homage to Iago when you are ready.

objectives: Use the Mysterious Device in the corner of the Plaza to talk to Jafar.

Go to the Stardust Port in the Dream Castle.
Interact with the Ancient Vessel to travel to Eternity Isle.

Interact with the Hologram Station to talk to Jafar.

Repair the Ancient Sphere at a Crafting Station.
Put the Ancient Sphere in the receptacle next to the Ancient Gate.
Open the Ancient Gate.
Go deeper into Eternity Isle.
Meet Jafar by the broken bridge in the Courtyard area.
Talk to Jafar at the Hologram Station.

objectives: Search for the "flying metal nuisance" to get the Royal Hourglass.

Talk to Jafar at one of the Hologram Stations around Ancient's Landing.
Go inside EVE's House in Ancient's Landing.
Remove the Piles of Junk inside EVE's House to find a clue.
Pick up the paper on the ground.
Return to Jafar at one of the Hologram Stations around Ancient's Landing.
Look for the hidden area shown in the Memory.

Investigate the Best Fish Forever Recipe in your Inventory.

(Find the broken half Goofy's Stall Sign in Ancient's Landing, then complete the "Give Me a Sign" Quest.)

  ‧ 1 Sea Snail.
Cook the Best Fish Forever for EVE.
Make sure the Best Fish Forever is in your Inventory.
Bring the food to EVE.
Pick up the Royal Hourglass.
Return to the Broken Bridge.
Talk to Jafar at the Hologram Station.

quests.name: The Sands in the Hourglass
objectives: Reach the Secluded Beach down the passage to the right of the broken bridge.

Use your Hourglass to search the Secluded Beach for what you need to repair the Statue:

Use your Hourglass to search for more materials lost in time around Ancient's Landing:

Use the Detailed Statue-Repair Instructions in your Inventory.
Craft the Statue's Arm at a Timebending Table.
Put the Statue's Arm back in its socket.
Return to the broken bridge in the Courtyard area.

Search for Mist with your Hourglass, or access the Dreamlight menu and investigate your new Mist Duties

objectives:
Find the remaining two Jewels of Time by investigating:

  ‧ Search for Mist with your Hourglass, or access the Dreamlight menu and investigate your new Mist Duties
Interact with the Time Anomaly in front of the door to Jafar's Palace.
Talk to Jafar.

Jafar has vanished. But you get the feeling he'll be back...
  ‧ Talk to Merlin.

quests.name: The Enchanted Flower
objectives: Talk to Merlin.
Search the Dreamlight Library for the Envelope of Seeds.

Go inside Elsa's Ice Cavern.
Find Elsa at the back of her Ice Cavern.
Talk to Elsa.

Take pictures of the Pedestal Symbols on the pedestals in Elsa's Ice Cavern.

Talk to Jasmine.

Something isn't right... Examine the Enchanted Flower.

Follow Jasmine to the Plaza.
Talk to Jasmine.
Follow the trail of giant petals.
Go inside the Giant Willow Tree.

quests.name: Wild, Wild Wishes

Collect the 8 chocolate meals in Anna's House.

Talk to Anna inside her House.
Talk to Mike.
Meet up with Mike in Scrooge's Store.
Listen to Mike and Mulan in Scrooge's Store.
Listen to Mike and Belle in Scrooge's Store.
Talk to Mike.
Talk to Jasmine.
Decorate a room in your home with 3 furniture you love. or Cook 2 of your favorite meals.
Talk to Jasmine.
Dress up in the outfit of your dreams.
Return to Jasmine.
Listen to Jasmine and Mike to see if the wish magic is gone.
Talk to Jasmine.

quests.name: The Ancient Revealed
objectives: Enter the Aladdin Realm.
Enter the Agrabah market.

The way to Jasmine is blocked!

Go through the back alleys by evading the dust devils.
  ‧ (Watch out! If you touch them, you'll be thrown back to a previous area.)

Continue traveling through the back alleys.
  ‧ Reach Jasmine in the market.

Talk to Jasmine.
Use planks to reach the rooftops leading to the Artisans' District.

Reach Aladdin, who is trapped in the South Alley.

objectives: Make sure you have the Ancient Tome in your Inventory.

quests.name: Wish Magic
objectives: Talk to Aladdin about his three wishes.

  ‧ Aladdin's first wish was made in a desert oasis...

Aladdin's second wish was made in water. This will be tricky...

  ‧ 40 Gold Shard from sandstone deposits.
